intro: Psychotria setacea, commonly known as the velvetleaf psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Psychotria setacea is often found in lowland rainforests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its ornamental value has also led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
